intro: Secamone emetica, commonly known as the emetic secamone, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many plants with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. Its leaves are typically opposite and ovate, with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The plant contains various alkaloids, some of which have been studied for their medicinal properties.
